node.title: What do China and Taiwan have to do with violent protests in Solomon Islands?
node.alt: Six armed police officers walk through the streets of Honiara.
node.description: Violent protests in Honiara saw buildings go up in flames and calls for the Prime Minister to resign. But what does this have to do with China and Taiwan?
node.content:
["Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare has announced a 36-hour lockdown of the country's capital, Honiara, after violent protests calling for his resignation led to the burning of buildings, including a\u00a0police station and a leaf hut next to Parliament House.", "Fresh protests have broken out in the\u00a0capital today, with smoke seen from Honiara's Chinatown district.", "What started as a peaceful protest of people primarily from the\u00a0Malaita Province\u00a0turned violent as a crowd of a\u00a0thousand\u00a0grew agitated.\u00a0", "", "
Large crowds gathered outside national parliament in Honiara.(ABC News: Evan Wasuka)
", "Police fired tear gas and rubber\u00a0bullets to disperse the crowd, while\u00a0buildings were stoned and others\u00a0went up in flames.", "Mr Sogavare said it was a \"sad and unfortunate event aimed at bringing a democratically-elected government down\".", "So, what has sparked the civil unrest and what do China and Taiwan have to do with it?", "
How are China and Taiwan involved?
", "At the centre of a deepening rift between the central government and Malaita Province\u00a0\u2014 the most populous island in the Solomon Islands archipelago \u2014\u00a0 is, somewhat surprisingly, foreign policy.", "The Solomon Islands had previously been among only a handful of countries with diplomatic ties to Taipei rather than Beijing \u2014 a significant proportion\u00a0of which are in the South Pacific.", "But in September 2019, Mr Sogavare established formal diplomatic ties with China.", "The ABC reported at the time\u00a0that some $US500 million ($730 million) worth of\u00a0financial aid had been promised\u00a0by Beijing to the Solomons\u00a0\u2014 one of the Pacific's poorest nations\u00a0\u2014\u00a0in exchange for the move.", "This led to Taiwan terminating its diplomatic relations with the Solomon Islands\u00a0after 36 years.", "\"We sincerely regret and strongly condemn [the Solomon Islands] government's decision to establish diplomatic relations with China,\" Taiwan's President\u00a0Tsai Ing-wen said at the time.", "Malaita Province\u00a0Premier Daniel Suidani has been outspoken in his opposition of the national government's decision to switch to China, and\u00a0South Pacific geopolitical researcher\u00a0Ed Cavanough said there was evidence that a\u00a0relationship between the province and Taiwan remained\u00a0in some form.", "Taiwan provided COVID-19 assistance such as personal protective equipment and food aid to Malaita, which Mr\u00a0Cavanough said was in contravention of national law in Solomon Islands.\u00a0", "Daniel Suidani, the Premier of Malaita, also travelled to Taiwan in May 2021 for medical treatment.", "
Why did this cause a rift in the Solomons' politics?
", "Mr\u00a0Sogavare said the decision to formalise ties with China was putting\u00a0Solomon Islands on \"the right side of history\".", "But not all agreed, with opposition politicians fiercely criticising the move.", "In August 2019, a group of senior politicians published an open letter condemning the\u00a0shift in relations.", "\"We believe the long-term interests of our country \u2014 in terms of our development aspirations, as well as respect for democratic principles, human rights, rule of law, human dignity, and mutual respect \u2014 lie with Taiwan, not the PRC [People's Republic of China],\" it read.", "It also warned\u00a0that establishing ties with Beijing could see land rights, rule of law and cultural heritage in the Solomon Islands \"compromised\".", "\"We are aware of important lessons from many countries \u2014 including in our region \u2014 who are locked in a serious debt trap as a result of their giving in to China's lures.\"", "Mr Suidani has continued to rail against the decision, which Mr\u00a0Cavanough said has served him to leverage \"incredible\" political popularity in\u00a0Malaita Province.", "\"We are strongly opposed to PRC\u00a0communist ideology and investment,\" Mr Suidani was quoted by the Solomon Times newspaper as saying in May last year.", "
Could we have predicted violent protests?
", "Wednesday's protests appeared to come as a surprise despite recognition of building tensions.", "Peter Kenilorea Jr, the son of the Solomon Islands' first prime minister and an opposition MP, last month warned the country's foreign policy was being \"overrun\" by China and that disagreements over Beijing's influence could lead to violence.", "\"Things don't build up very clearly in the Solomon Islands \u2014 things explode suddenly,\" he said in an interview with\u00a0the Sunday Guardian, an Indian newspaper.", "\"The analogy that I think is most apt is that we in the Pacific Islands say we are on the frontline of climate change \u2014 here in the Solomons, we are also on the frontline of the aggression from the Chinese Communist Party.", "\"The political warfare is on. The geopolitical frontline is in our tiny nation of the Solomon Islands, and even within the provinces within the Solomons.", "\"We have one province (Malaita) that has been targeted and harassed \u2014 this is a real everyday occurrence.", "\"Leaders that are willing to take a stand against what they feel is undue interference from a foreign power are getting motions of no confidence, efforts to besmirch them, those kinds of efforts are ongoing now.\"", "
Has this sort of thing happened before?
", "Yes.", "Australia deployed a peacekeeping mission known as\u00a0the Regional Assistance Mission to Solomon Islands (RAMSI) in 2003 after years of ethnic tension\u00a0and violence between militia from the islands of Guadalcanal and Malaita.", "Honiara has also\u00a0seen violent demonstrations target ethnic\u00a0Chinese-owned businesses in the past.", "In 2006, following the election of then-prime minister\u00a0Snyder Rini, rioters looted and burned Chinese-owned businesses, because of claims that the election had been rigged with the financial assistance of Chinese businesspeople.", "Many Chinese residents were left homeless, and the riots led to the deployment of Australian and New Zealand soldiers to help restore order.", "Riots again broke out after the current Prime Minister, Mr Sogavare, was elected for the fourth time in 2019, with police using tear gas to dispel crowds in the city's Chinatown.", "\"I honestly thought that we had gone past the darkest days in the history of our country,\" Mr Sogavare said in response to Wednesday's unrest.", "\"Today's events are a painful reminder that we have a long way to go.\"", "
Will Sogavare stand down?
", "Most don't think so.", "Mr Cavanough said he believed it\u00a0was \"very unlikely\" Mr\u00a0Sogavare would stand down.", "\"He was democratically elected through their process back\u00a0in 2019,\" he said.", "\"Though the China switch, which has led to a lot of tension, kind of came as a surprise, he had long been on the record really being opposed to the Taiwan partnership.\u00a0", "\"It didn't come entirely as a\u00a0surprise.\"", "Mr\u00a0Cavanough said the only natural resolution to the\u00a0enduring stand-off between\u00a0Mr\u00a0Sogavare and Mr\u00a0Suidani would be an election.", "\"The next election isn't until 2023 as well, so the reality is that the country is going to be stuck in the dynamic for quite some time.\"", "
What is likely to happen next?
", "Neighbouring Papua New Guinea's Prime Minister James Marape has appealed to the people of Solomon Islands to \"respect the rule of law and democratic institutions\", urging them \"not to take the law into their own hands\".", "\"Solomon Islands has always been a beacon of hope for us in Melanesia, and a middle ground for many of our Pacific and Melanesian issues, so I ask for peaceful democratic dialogue to any issues of discontent,\" Mr Marape said.", "But those on the ground say there is likely to be more unrest before the dust settles.", "Local journalist Gina Kekea while the protests surprised most in Honiara,\u00a0she believes the \"worst is yet to come\".", "Police said they would\u00a0\"continue to conduct high visibility patrols throughout Honiara day and night to make sure those planning to disturb the peace that continues to dominate our communities have any chance of carrying out their criminal activities\".", "", "
Labor accuses Government of 'amping up' war threat with China
"]
